normalized: the era was――the future.
an age when mankind had begun spreading out through the cosmos.
a large number of terraformed planets had appeared, and humanity's territory had expanded to the entire solar system.
the spread of humanity throughout space had, naturally, brought about a change in human history.
there had been an increase in the number of people referred to as 『spacemen』, whose birthplace was not earth, and a change of thinking which accompanied that.
it was a historical inevitability that a universal federal government, which recognized the sovereignty of each star colony, had been set up in order to redress the previous earth-centric laws.
the reunification of mankind had been going on for 10 years.
contrary to everybody's efforts, the antagonism between the spacemen and the old human race, who were protective of their interests, was deep-rooted even now.
the 『neo terras』 yearned for control of the universe by those who lived on and embraced the earth, the land of humanity's origin.
the 『new solars』 aimed for autonomous self-government for the space colonies and star colonies, with the planet titan being top of the list.
and 『cordelia』, which was referred to as the third pole, coming right after those two.
the universe was smouldering with a flame which still hadn't gone out.
cordelia.
once, that name had referred to a moon which orbited the innermost path of all of uranus's satellites.
and now, that name referred to a semi-artificial heavenly body 56 kilometres in diameter, which had been built with the moon at its core.
having been specially terraformed, its surface was covered by alloy armour, and a living space which imitated earth's environment had been created inside.
population: 3 530 00.
it was the solar system's biggest fortified artificial celestial city.
by contrast, the earth's population was 6 500 00 00, and titan's was 1 200 00 00.
there was a reason that cordelia, which was a city-state far smaller than those places, was known as the third pole.
uranos――a unique liquid metal produced from the core of the planet uranus.
what they made by processing this rare metal was uranos alloy armour.

it was a special alloy, possessing an energy deflection attribute that could withstand a direct hit from a level 5 phaser gun (which was the chief weapon of the mid-sized battleships that were the mainstay of the space federation army), and endowed with a hardness that could suffi-ciently withstand a direct hit from all existing physical-damage weapons.
and the technology to process and manufacture it was almost completely monopolized by cordelia.
the technological power to harness uranos was what made cordelia cordelia.
cordelia had rapidly gained power in the milky way.
would that bring about peace, or the scourge of war?
nobody knew right now.
nevertheless, cordelia――that name was derived from the name of king lear's third daughter, who appeared in shakespeare's play, 『king lear』.
she was extremely pure, and was consequently exiled by her father, the king, temporarily became queen of france, and met her tragic death in prison.
now, nobody even knew that.
the universe was expanding, deeply and quietly, as if to swallow up the fate of mere man.
the satellite city of cordelia.
spaceport no.
the adele-class mid-sized warship, the jerkel.
within said warship, in the operations room――

name: dino
normalized: that's not what we agreed on!
i involuntarily raised my voice.
i could see shivers run through the subordinates in the strategy room.
that was because they knew i really hated situations like this.

and most of all, they knew how scrupulously i had designed the tactical plans, how long i had spent, how meticulously i had paid attention to the details, and how much i had done for the sake of this plan: manoeuvring to incorporate cordelia into the neo terra faction.
by doing so, i had made all of my manoeuvring up to this point a success.
now, an irregularity had appeared in the plan.
furthermore, the cause of it was a woman.

name: dino
normalized: （shit…）
i cursed in my mind.
my name is dino dilasso.
i was a commander in the space federation army, and the captain of the battleship jerkel, used for the transportation of important people.
the brunt of my anger―a woman who had suddenly sent me a mocking communication―was calm in spite of my objections.
no, probably because i was the one she was talking to, her arrogant expression, which looked down on people, had taken on a shine.
the woman's name was kiria jeff.
a space federation army major general.
a female general known as one of the hardliners within the neo terras faction.
a figure with a shady past, who wanted to get ahead by sucking up to the neo terran leadership.
as one could easily imagine from the impertinent woman's face, she posed as an elite, with a high sense of superiority.
she was a conspirator who ruthlessly plotted against her opponents and people she didn't like, even if they were fellow neo terras.
she had a reputation as such in the army, but if you asked me, the woman's shallow cleverness went no further than having things turn out well by accident.
once, i had been in charge of investigating this woman on suspicion of murdering a fellow officer among the neo terras.
the charges had been dropped due to insufficient evidence, but from the perspective of me, the investigator, she was utterly guilty.
we had had a dog-and-monkey relationship ever since.
(tl: i.
e.
, a cat-and-dog relationship)

name: dino
normalized: ma'am, that's not what you said before.
i said to the female general once again, while holding back my anger.

name: kiria
normalized: not what i said, huh…?
the general said, after enjoying my attitude for a while.

name: kiria
normalized: i'm telling you that i am not your tool.

name: dino
normalized: i don't know what you're talking about.

name: kiria
normalized: impertinent, aren't you?
it looks like you're trying to use my fleet to your own advantage, and i'm telling you that's not going to work, commander.

name: dino
normalized: i did get authorization from operations hq, did i not…?
ma'am.

name: kiria
normalized: of course, commander.
this is something i don't think the likes of an intelligence officer can resolve.
in the end, military power means everything.
there was a detestable gleam in her eyes, which looked down on me through the monitor.
those eyes were characteristic of the insolent woman, who prioritized emotion over reason, but believed the opposite herself.

name: dino
normalized: （tch, why are women like this?
i couldn't help but curse at her in my mind.

name: dino
normalized: （this whore…!
in my plan, we would first provoke cordelia with a few units and make them attack our troops, and then we would use that as an excuse to sortie our large fleet.
at the same time, by making the domestic neo terras faction betray them, it meant we would get to occupy cordelia from inside and out.
even if that didn't result in occupation, i had tremendous confidence in the success of another sub-plan.
either way, as long as there weren't too many obstacles, my plan would have succeeded.
suddenly, our armada had been deployed due to the interference of this female general, kiria jeff.
now, it was like the neo terras had aggressively started a war with cordelia.
the public opinion of the cordelian people would end up leaning 100％ toward hating the neo terras.
even if kiria's fleet destroyed the cordelian army head-on, the neo terras would become the enemies of the cordelian people.
after that, even cordelia's domestic neo terras faction probably wouldn't cooperate with us easily.
moreover, some of them would probably even leave and become anti-neo terra.

name: dino
normalized: （does this stupid woman not understand these things?!

name: kiria
normalized: fufu…
kiria was making a triumphant smile.
she seemed happy from the bottom of her heart to have been able to get in my way.
perhaps she was expecting that my true identity would be uncovered in the middle of my mission to infiltrate cordelia, and i would be arrested or something.

name: dino
normalized: （however, i have a sub-plan.
you wouldn't know… it's a plan which the likes of you couldn't even imagine.

name: kiria
normalized: you look like you want to say something, huh, commander?

name: dino
normalized: no… anyway, i'll pray for luck in battle, major general kiria jeff.
i said to the female general, as courteously as possible.

name: dino
normalized: take great care not to underestimate “cordelia's onihime” and the “armoured knights”.
they are not opponents an ordinary person can defeat.
kiria reacted to me saying “ordinary person”, and her expression completely changed.

name: dino
normalized: of course, i don't have to tell you, do i, ma'am?
this is a job for an intelligence officer.
please, allow me.
kiria bared her animosity towards me as i bowed.

name: kiria
normalized: hmph.
and you make sure not to accidentally die in the middle of the battle.
that's often the case in a chaotic battleground.
especially when stupid intelligence officers are bumbling around.
kiria said, and ended the transmission.

name: dino
normalized: shit!
that whore!
i spit onto the floor.
and then, after cursing at her briefly, i got in touch with a subordinate through the warship's internal communications.

name: dino
normalized: it's me.

name: subordinate
normalized: yes, captain.

name: dino
normalized: starting now, we are switching to the “sub-plan”.
i'll leave the preparations to you.
i'm going to the minister's place.

name: subordinate
normalized: understood.
i ended the call.

name: dino
normalized: （the sub-plan, huh?
that's all right.
i was hoping for that.

name: dino
normalized: i am a man who is always on the side of the victor!
i muttered to myself, and casually left the operations room behind.
